# Contents {.unnumbered}

This web book version of the report is structured into 17 chapters and two
appendices.

:::{.custom-toc .report-contents}


* @sec-introduction: Introduction
    * @sec-why-need: Why we need civil service effectiveness indicators
    * @sec-how-developed: How InCiSE has been further developed
    * @sec-not-aiming: What InCiSE is not aiming to do
    * @sec-who-for: Who InCiSE is for
* @sec-incise-framework: The InCiSE framework and approach
    * @sec-defining-framework: Defining the InCiSE framework
    * @sec-data-availability: Data availability, limitations and revisions
    * @sec-comparisons: Comparisons with the 2017 Pilot edition of InCiSE
    * @sec-data-sources: Data sources
    * @sec-country-coverage: Country coverage
    * @sec-coverage-variations: Variations in data quality by country
* @sec-index-results: Results of the 2019 InCiSE Index
    * @sec-rankings: Overall scores and rankings for the InCiSE Index
    * @sec-policy-making: Policy making
    * @sec-fiscal: Fiscal and financial management
    * @sec-regulation: Regulation
    * @sec-crisis-risk: Crisis and risk management
    * @sec-hrm: Human resource management
    * @sec-tax: Tax administration
    * @sec-digital-services: Digital Services
    * @sec-procurement: Procurement
    * @sec-integrity: Integrity
    * @sec-openness: Openness
    * @sec-capabilities: Capabilities
    * @sec-inclusiveness: Inclusiveness
* @sec-country-profiles: Country profiles of the 2019 InCiSE results
* @sec-next-steps: Next steps and conclusions
    * @sec-looking-ahead: Looking ahead
    * @sec-conclusion: Conclusion
* Appendices
    * @sec-definitions: InCiSE 2019 indicator definitions
    * @sec-data-sources: InCiSE 2019 data sources
    * @sec-scores-rankings: InCiSE 2019 country scores and rankings
    * @sec-accessible-content: Accessible content


:::

### Changes compared to the original 2019 publication

Please note that @sec-index-results and @sec-country-profiles of this web book
provide interactive versions of the report content which may not be fully
accessible, [static versions](X_static_content.qmd) are available in the
Appendices to this report.
